Pothos

Epipremnum aureum

âŒToxic to Cats
Contains calcium oxalate crystals that cause immediate burning and irritation in the mouth, lips, and tongue. Cats often chew it out of curiosity due to trailing vinesâ€”but even a small bite causes distress.

ğŸš¨ What to Do If Your Cat Eats This Plant

Not usually life-threateningâ€”but very painful. Act quickly.

  1. Remove plant fragments from your catâ€™s mouth.
  2. Rinse gently with cool water.
  3. Offer a lick of plain yogurt or a few drops of milk to neutralize crystals.
  4. Call your vet if symptoms last more than 2â€“3 hours.

ğŸ’¡ Pro tip: Hang Pothos out of reachâ€”or replace with a safe vine like String of Hearts (non-toxic!).
